omopColumns.name: nhs_number
omopColumns.query:
with Lung as (
  select 
    Record ->> '$.Lung.LungCore.LungCoreTreatment.LungCoreSurgeryAndOtherProcedures.ProcedureDate' as ProcedureDate,
    Record ->> '$.Lung.LungCore.LungCoreLinkagePatientId.NHSNumber.@extension' as NHSNumber,
    Record ->> '$.Lung.LungCore.LungCoreTreatment.LungCoreSurgeryAndOtherProcedures.PrimaryProcedureOPCS.@code' as PrimaryProcedureOPCS
  from omop_staging.cosd_staging_81
  where Type = 'LU'
)
select
      distinct
          ProcedureDate,
          NhsNumber,
          PrimaryProcedureOPCS
from Lung l
where l.ProcedureDate is not null and l.PrimaryProcedureOPCS is not null;

omopColumns.name: procedure_concept_id
omopColumns.operation_description: Maps concepts to standard valid concepts in the `procedure` domain.

omopColumns.name: procedure_type_concept_id
omopColumns.operation_description: Constant value set to `32828`. `EHR episode record`

omopColumns.name: procedure_source_value

dataSource.name: PrimaryProcedureOpcs
dataSource.description: PRIMARY PROCEDURE (OPCS) is the OPCS Classification of Interventions and Procedures code which is used to identify the primary Patient Procedure carried out.

omopColumns.name: procedure_source_concept_id
omopColumns.operation_description: Resolve OPCS4 codes to OMOP concepts. If code cannot be mapped, map using the parent code.
